page.title: 16EXPLAINING THE WARBOYS SIGN
page.content: The sign has two sides. One side shows the brickyard (which has since closed down) and a ploughing team to show the main means of employment,the other shows the Manor House and the huntsmen represent the meet that used to take place. The mill is a reminder that the village once had three mills, all now demolished. The sign is supported by two witches which are a reminder of the connection of Warboys with witchcraft. The stones for the plinth were gathered by village children. The sign was unveiled on the 18th. July, 1981. A plaque commemorates the wedding of Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer on the 29th.July, 1981. Two children from the school unveiled the sign. Justin Dyer represented the families who had lived in the village for many years and Sarah Bowen the families who had recently arrived.
